column1: Womens RAW Best Lifter: Ginger Viera
Womens Assisted Best Lifter: Tammy Howard
Lightweight RAW Best Lifter: James Aikey
Lighweight Best Lifter - Regular Gear: Mike Andersen
Heavyweight RAW Best Lifter: Michael Berby
Heavyweight Overall Best Lifter & Regular Gear Best Lifter: Sebastien Grenier
Heavyweight Unlimited Gear Best Lifter: Mike Ahearn
Push & Pull Lightweight RAW Best Lifter: Bryan Cunningham
Push & Pull Heavyweight RAW Best Lifter: Gary Stewart
Push & Pull Unlimited Gear Best Lifter: James Matta
Bench Press RAW Lightweight Best Lifter: Marcel St-Laurent
Bench Press RAW Heavyweight Best Lifter: Brian Lapila
Bench Press Assisted Best Lifter: Adam Szeps
Deadlift RAW Best Lifter: Tom Chojnowski
Deadlift Lightweight Assisted Best Lifter: Claude Dallaire
Deadlift Heavyweight Assisted Best Lifter: Eddie Difruscia
This years event drew lifters from all over including the borders of Mexico and several sections of Canada.  Some awesome RAW and assisted lifts were
done and several records were set.  All new records will be listed soon on the APA website. Regardless of several back surgeries and slipped discs in his
back Eddie Difruscia showed up to do a whopping 625 lb. deadlift at 197 bodyweight.  The pull was in honor of Dr.  Brian Matchett who was an awesome
powerlifter, trainer of many New England area powerlifters, and especially a friend to all veterans in the New England area.  If it were not for Dr. Matchetts
efforts as head of the DAV in New Hampshire many of us Vietnam Veterans would not have had the quality care we had when being treated by the VA.
I as a veteran can personally attest to that.  When I had a major surgery Dr. Matchett went through channels and made sure I received excellent treatment
and actually had the Chief of Staff at the VA hospital perform my surgery.  Dr. Brian Matchett will be sadly missed by all of the veterans and many in the
powerlifting world who had the honor of knowing this great man.  He was a highly decorated Vietnam Vet and gave his country his full 100% serving us both
Special thanks to James Matta for organizing the event and setting up all the meet spotters, loaders, referee's and some awesome equipment including
several monolifts.  I look forward to next years event.
I enjoyed meeting Russian Lifter Andrei Audovikine who competed in the event.  I had communicated with him off and on over the years and it was nice
to finally know the face behind the emails and posts.
We could not have asked for a better venue, equipment, or meet conditions.  Once again, special thanks for James Matta for doing a lot of hard work making
